intro: Serapias glabra, commonly known as the smooth serapias, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Its leaves are broad, lance-shaped, and covered in a fine pubescence, while its flowers are borne on long, slender stems. Serapias glabra is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies for various ailments.
